programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: UFO
programme.desc: Straker and Freeman stare death in the face as they try to track down a killer who can apparently read their every thought. Gerry Anderson's sci-fi drama, starring Ed Bishop and George Sewell

programme.title: Mercenaries (2011)
programme.desc: A former SAS commando leaves the British army to become a soldier for hire, operating out of the Balkans. He is recruited by the US authorities for a top-secret rescue mission when their ambassador to Serbia is taken hostage by a former general and wanted war criminal during a coup. Action adventure, with Robert Fucilla and Billy Zane

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt (2014)
programme.desc: District attorney Mitch Brockden is involved in a fatal hit-and-run incident, and a convicted felon is charged with his crime. Mitch's guilt drives him to throw out the case when it comes to trial - but when the accused later goes on a killing spree, he feels compelled to bring him to justice personally. Crime thriller, starring Dominic Cooper and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Saturn 3 (1980)
programme.desc: A deranged killer steals an experimental robot and assumes the identity of a new recruit at an isolated research station on one of Saturn's moons. As he sets about teaching the machine to think for itself, it takes on some of his darker impulses and turns on the two human scientists running the base. Martin Amis-scripted sci-fi thriller, starring Kirk Douglas, Harvey Keitel and Farrah Fawcett

programme.title: Countess Dracula (1971)
programme.desc: A Hungarian countess discovers bathing in the blood of virgins is the secret of eternal youth, and demands her lover bring her a steady stream of victims. However, her affair with another man turns him against her, while the spate of disappearing young women arouses suspicion. Hammer horror, starring Ingrid Pitt, Nigel Green and Lesley-Anne Down

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Alfie's upset to see Kat and Dennis together. Gus attempts to do the right thing

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An overzealous taxman sets out to snare Lovejoy - not to mention an axe-wielding jailbird determined to retrieve an ornate Arab head-dress. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dawn's son slips into a coma, leaving surgeons in a state of confusion as to what could have brought about his rapid deterioration. It's not long before estranged father Keith turns up on the scene, adding to the air of tension as his wife's involvement with Andrew comes to light. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Sarah Parish

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: As Fleur's christening approaches, the couple struggle to find appropriate godparents

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince upsets the female members of the Warrender family by crashing Penny's car and causing her mother to faint in the street

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Chaos abounds at an annual parade held to celebrate a famous battle. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up and Nora Batty prepares to sit on a float playing the part of his wife. Norman Wisdom makes a cameo appearance

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Danny takes Gerry on the run as they search for the proof they need to prove his innocence - despite Gerry remaining tight-lipped about his involvement with dodgy dealings in his old unit. The stakes are high as the Unsolved Crime and Open Case Squad goes after one of the biggest crime families in London, and it's those closest to Gerry who are dangerously put in the firing line. Starring Dennis Waterman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo and Harry's professional rivalry erupts following Sam's departure. They deal with the case of several children who experienced unexplained breathing difficulties, leaving one of them dead. While Harry believes this was mass hysteria, Leo suspects something more sinister. Meanwhile, a man is found dead in his car with a stab wound to the chest. Tom Ward and William Gaminara star

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Angela and Tony Forshaw want to sue for damages when their daughter Laura is refused a place at Cambridge. Peter discovers why Gloria and her son Scott are acting strangely, and Snell takes on the gas company when they threaten to build on sheep-grazing land. Meanwhile, more information comes to light about Simon's lifestyle

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey's kitchen goes up in smoke so Dorien, looking for an escape from visiting her mother-in-law, allows the sisters spend the weekend with her while the new kitchen is installed. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is ordered to track down two OAP fraudsters - but he seems more interested in getting his hands on their recipe for bread-and-butter pudding. Being lumbered with a temporary partner only complicates matters for the cuisine-loving policeman, and leads to friction with Cambridge. Guest starring Joan Sims, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A schoolgirl asks Lovejoy to sell some priceless 18th-century erotic drawings on her behalf, but he soon realises there is more to the request than meets the eye. Starring Ian McShane and Caroline Blakiston

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac must fight for control of the hospital when a returning patient wreaks havoc. Reeling from Skylar's tragedy, the F1s try to cover their tracks when a flirtatious patient makes a serious accusation. Grieving Sacha is scared of letting go of his daughter while a desperate Jodie is on the loose, and his usual arsenal of lies, delays and deceptions may not be enough to keep Beka safe

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie introduces Cyril to Karen, and Duffy encounters a man who has been abusing his girlfriend. Derek Thompson stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jack Meadows tears a strip off Phil Hunter and Debbie McAllister for not reaching their targets as sergeants, and the latter's fury turns to jealousy when the DCI teams her up with new DC Juliet Becker, who displays brains and beauty in equal measure. Meanwhile, Luke Ashton's public outing by his estranged wife is the talk of the station

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Can Phil and Kate put the past behind them, when Dalton has just offered Phil 5000 pounds to kill Kate

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As Phil and Kate prepare to return to the Square, will Sharon's concerns about Dennis be confirmed? Alfie makes an attempt to impress Kat

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Major Maclean stages a robbery to make a false insurance claim, but before Hamish can settle the case, DI Bruce instigates a major surveillance operation. Rural drama, starring Robert Carlyle

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plans an elaborate double-cross to get his hands on a pair of valuable Meissen figurines, sold to Lovejoy by a woman who needed some quick cash to buy drugs. Drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: New boy Sam Morgan breaks all the rules and gets emotionally involved with a patient, jeopardising his career at the Beeches almost before it's begun. Joseph Millson stars, with Gary Mavers and Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec's daughter Simone causes problems as she tries to help out at the office. Bittersweet comedy, starring Anton Rodgers, Lesley Dunlop and Carolyn Pickles

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Things start to look up for the Warrenders as Norman's job prospects improve, but things are not running so smoothly in the Pinner household - especially when Vince goes to court for his divorce hearing and ends up losing most of his money

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Lyle helps horse trainer Herb Griffiths lease a field for his prize racer Market Mischief, but finds his loyalties tested when travellers take up residence there and are then accused of stealing the racehorse. Peter has been instructed by his client Mrs Collins to file for divorce from her cross-dressing husband, but the optimistic solicitor believes a reconciliation is possible with his intervention. Hill returns to seek payment on Simon's debt. Robert Bathurst guests

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: The owner of an ice-cream factory is found dead in a walk-in freezer, and while Davey pursues the man's son as prime suspect, Jane finds evidence to suggests his wife is to blame

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Danny and Steve 'welcome' new boss Ted Case into the UCOS office in Sasha's absence, but for all his experience, keen eye for detail and a killer instinct for detecting liars, they aren't as sold on his superstitious quirks. While trying to work one another out, the team treads carefully in the case of a murdered vicar who received racist hate mail in the lead up to his death. With emotions running high, it's up to Ted to pull together his new unit and keep the peace in one of UCOS's most sensitive cases. Starring Larry Lamb, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Emilia Fox joins the cast of the crime drama as Dr Nikki Alexander, who uses the team's equipment to solve an Iron Age mystery, but ends up bringing her expertise to bear on a modern murder. The case in question is the death of a jockey crushed by his mount during a race. The plot thickens when two of the horses' owners are killed in a helicopter crash and evidence emerges that both the horse and the pilot were drugged. James Wilby and Sylvestra Le Touzel guest star

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Anne prepares to leave for Europe and put her doomed romance behind her - but she has unfinished business before she departs. She undertakes a daring plan to sink her own pit and expose the Rawsons' industrial-scale theft of the coal on her land. In Scotland, Ann feels increasingly isolated when she discovers that Captain Sutherland is planning to marry her off to his penniless cousin. Thomas Sowden plucks up the courage to ask Mr Washington for his eldest daughter's hand in marriage

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac must fight for control of the hospital when a returning patient wreaks havoc. programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is assigned to nail the crook responsible for a spate of burglaries and links the crimes to a notorious poultry millionaire, but has no evidence to back up his suspicions. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The corpse of a recently married man is found hidden in an antique suit of armour - much to Lovejoy's dismay. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton

programme.desc: The Darwin team struggles to save patients as the hospital goes into lockdown. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Megan encourages Charlie to be honest, while staff deal with a juggler's broken toe and a fashion model who needs urgent tests to detect a life-threatening condition

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Borough Commander Jane Fitzwilliam is furious that the Coal Lane Estate has been taken over by a private security firm, so Adam Okaro hatches a plan. His secret weapon is Ken Drummond, who continues moonlighting at the company, this time with his superintendent's blessing, to see what he can find out. Meanwhile, psychotic DC Cathy Bradford is back with a vengeance

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dennis lies to Sharon and the police - but for different reasons!

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon learns that Vicki carried out the robbery - not Dennis

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Religious fanatic Cameron bans rehearsals for a local amateur dramatics production after discovering his daughter has fallen for her stage lover - played by the son of impoverished crofter Duncan. It's up to Hamish and the villagers to make him change his mind. Robert Carlyle and Ken Drury star

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A robbery at the local museum sets Lovejoy off on the trail of a hoard of Roman coins hidden on the Isle of Man - but he soon discovers two Americans are also searching for it. Drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam makes an unusual bet with a smoker anxious to quit, and Joanna confides in pub landlady Rita, while Andrew tries to help a farmer whose failing health has prompted him to run amok in Cardale, leaving a trail of devastation behind him. Joseph Millson, Haydn Gwynne and Gary Mavers star

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Against husband Alec's wishes, Zoe sets herself a date to return to work, but struggles to find a nanny for baby Fleur. Meanwhile, her mother Dot has her hands full coping with a new admirer. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Lesley Dunlop

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Mismatched lovers Penny and Vince are due to get married. The last-ever episode of John Sullivan's romantic comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: Tracking a local conman, Frank and Lu make some unlikely allies when they encounter a pair of deadly gangsters. Mark Benton and Jo Joyner star in the comedy drama about an oddball couple of private detectives who investigate crime in Stratford-upon-Avon

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: When the duo are hired to help close down an old bingo hall, Frank is surprised to find an old enemy at work - but what is he really up to? Guest starring Jim Moir, aka Vic Reeves, with Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is approached by a group of survivors from a recent train crash, who want the members to uncover the reasons for the disaster. In the process investigators stumble upon another mystery, when one of the bodies pulled from the wreckage remains unidentified. With Emilia Fox, William Gaminara, Tom Ward, Amita Dhiri and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Anne Lister journeys north to Denmark while acting as chaperone to an aristocratic young woman, and finds herself embraced in the royal court. Despite her joyous new life, she remains haunted by her estrangement from her lost love. When bad news reaches her, she faces the prospect of returning to confront the past. Ann Walker makes a bold resolution about her future, while an unexpected visitor threatens to finally expose Thomas Sowden's macabre secret. Sofie Grabol (The Killing) guest stars as the queen of Denmark

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The Darwin team struggles to save patients as the hospital goes into lockdown. Cameron faces being exposed as completely out of his depth, and is forced to phone Nicky for advice in theatre. Alex tries to help a stressed Donna to remain calm, stirring up some unresolved feelings, while Dom decides to return to the world of internet dating

programme.desc: Things explode in the Panesar household as secrets are spilled and rage takes over. Lily is upset with Stacey when she can't afford new trainers and Elaine tries to right her wrongs with Gina and Anna with a girly pamper afternoon

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: First into the Repair Shop is Alison who brings with her an 1890s ventriloquist's puppet called George. The puppet helped Alison grow in confidence and gave her an outlet for her undiagnosed dyslexia as a child but he's now broken both inside and out. Organ-restorer David Burville brings Kirsten Ramsay and the teddy bear ladies to help restore George to his former glory. Lewys from Wales brings in a brass cornet dating back to 1897 that has passed through generations of his family. What once filled his home with music is now completely unplayable, instrument expert Pete Woods gets to work. Nick from Somerset brings in the broken remains of a Roman-style chair that belonged to his late father Richard for upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary to repair. Book-restorer Chris Shaw is tasked with fixing up a notebook that once belonged to Kat's grandmother Mildred in the 1940s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers take on new challenges in Reduce Reuse Recycle week, starting with making a pair of trousers with zero-waste before tackling a mountain of wasted tote bags in the Transformation Challenge. For a Made to Measure outfit, the sewers have been asked to source second-hand crochet blankets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon manages to manipulate David and Michael into working with him again after Lucy teaches him the power of the phrase 'is there a version'

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David tries to arrange Georgia's birthday party through a series of favours and the group wonder who will play Scrooge in their upcoming radio play

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Care worker Peter lost out on 3,000 when scammers convinced him they were from his bank's fraud team. Jim Browning is the scourge of the scammers working with the police to get them arrested. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, a midwife and her builder husband buy a house which hasn't been lived in for a decade. However, they have big plans to create their forever home for them and their four children. Plus, two houses in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, and Wakefield, West Yorkshire are bought at auction by developers who plan to rent them out. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of new new owners as they bring their plans to fruition

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett has her first driving lesson, Jimmi tries to convince Emma to return to being a forensic medical examiner with the police, while Suni helps a dancing couple get back on their feet

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a drop-leaf table, a pair of legless dining chairs and a collection of unwanted curtains at High Wycombe recycling centre for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a retired couple who want to reconnect with their Scottish roots in Ayrshire. They have a budget of 500,000 and a view over water is a priority. Away from the search, Jonnie also learns about an ancient technique to create salt using sea water and an impressive tower of blackthorn branches

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vinny gives Suki an ultimatum and Stacey worries about Lily when Amy tells her about the older man who bought her trainers. Tensions are high at Elaine's girly pamper day and Rocky tries to help Kathy get the guests she wants at her wedding

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Chorlton, Greater Manchester, where they come up with designs for a garden that will remind owners Louise and Steve of their wedding in New Orleans. The couple's garden already has some mature plants that the designers are keen to incorporate to full effect, plus they already have an attractive pond that they'd like the duo to expand without disturbing its current inhabitants. Charlie and Lee try to bring the US to the north-west on a budget of 4,000

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.desc: The curators continue their restoration of Paul McCartney's childhood home in Liverpool, trying to track down a key section of wallpaper for the living room, and opening up a room the public has not yet seen - the bedroom where the former Beatle's parents slept. Across town, a project is under way to catalogue and clean a vast collection of photographs discovered in a four-storey Georgian house that was once the home and studio of Edward Chambr Hardman, one of Britain's most significant photographers

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A beachcombing scrap metal artist, a nautical resin worker and a fairy-tale sculptor create seaside-themed pieces for buyers from Whitstable. Nick Knowles hosts

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: This episode looks at life on the highest mountain range on Earth, the Himalayas, home to many extraordinary animals and remarkable ancient cultures. The programme follows snow leopards as they creep into isolated mountain villages searching for food, and monkeys huddling for warmth in a hidden, frozen forest, and the athletes who compete in the gruelling Everest marathon

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein look back at their examination of the historic case against Charlotte Bryant, and the story of a murder that tore a family apart in the 1930s

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Some of the best unseen finds from the show's valuation days from around the country, including visits to the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke and Ragley Hall in Warwickshire

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo alights at Wareham to visit Dorset's internationally renowned Jurassic Coast. He heads through Swanage, Poole and Sandbanks, before ending his journey on Brownsea Island

programme.title: Digging for Britain: The Greatest Discoveries
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts re-examines the key archaeological sites of Anglo-Saxon Britain and finds the evidence of a warrior culture and the enormous wealth of their aristocracy

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Cornwall's Tintagel, famed as the legendary birthplace of King Arthur. Ben discovers Tintagel was potentially more important than London a thousand years ago, based on recent evidence unearthed at an archaeological dig overseen by English Heritage. It was found that over 2,000 people were living here which, at the time, which would have made it the largest settlement anywhere of its kind in Britain

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan dig a little deeper into the behaviours seen on the live nest cameras at RSPB Arne in Dorset, as well as covering the topical wildlife stories of this season. Megan McCubbin travels down to a quarry on the Isle of Purbeck to find out why this location is so important for bats, and Gillian Burke continues her exploration of Anglesey

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at all the stuff that's been going on in the news this week, with Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Jen Brister, Rhys James and Ahir Shah

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury 2016
programme.desc: Highlights from the festival, featuring performances by Adele, ZZ Top, Christine and the Queens, ELO, Laura Mvula, Tame Impala, the 1975, Ellie Goulding, Foals, PJ Harvey, Muse, Earth, Wind and Fire and Coldplay

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Finals week begins with the four hopefuls heading to Istanbul, where they are paired up to cook two local dishes rooted in centuries of tradition, mentored by one of Turkey's best-known chefs - Refika Birgl. They then work a busy lunch service with chef Fatih Tutak at Turk - the only restaurant in the city to have been awarded two Michelin stars - before cooking lunch for the British Consulate General and various other guests, including three judges from the Turkish version of MasterChef

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The aspiring chefs are put through their paces by celebrated chef Clare Smyth, who cut her teeth with pioneers Gordon Ramsay and Alain Ducasse, at her central London restaurant Core. They each cook one of her food creations at a special lunch for a select group of chefs including Sat Bains, Tom Kitchin, Jonny Lake and Nieves Barragn Mohacho. Can the amateurs hold their nerve or will the pressure prove too intense?

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: Framed through the world-famous Wimbledon tournament, this series revisits a golden age of tennis during the 1970s and '80s that changed the sport forever. The series begins in 1975 as two tennis greats - Billie Jean King and Arthur Ashe - aim to win Wimbledon titles but also, in their own ways, to change the world for the better. Back in the late '60s, as the women's liberation movement becomes headline news, King took up the gauntlet for women in sport, spearheading the drive for equal prize money and equal treatment of women

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace spends the day in the York factory where the famous Polo mints are made, to follow the process from grading the sugar, making the dough and drying the mixture to adding the flavour and pressing the sweets into their famous mini doughnut shape. Cherry Healey visits the largest sugar beet factory in Europe and historian Ruth Goodman explores the clever marketing that persuaded many people to purchase minty mouthwash

programme.title: Eggheads

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The duo go baking in Italy, where dishes include a classic focaccia with rosemary, and pasta pie. They also pay a visit to Si's sister, who lives in Tuscany

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: On the Wirral, today's artists create artworks to complement a recently completed house renovation. Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The final episode focuses on life on the longest mountain range in the world, the Andes, home to astonishing hidden worlds, and extraordinary animals and people. Cameras follow a female puma and her three cubs as they hunt in the mountains of the frozen south, and the descendants of the Inca gather in an ancient ceremony to build a bridge made from woven grass

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein revisit their investigation into the historic case, conviction and execution of Alfred Moore, who murdered two policemen

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: In Muncaster, Cumbria, hundreds of people turn up with collectibles and treasures they want to take to auction. Antiques experts James Lewis and Caroline Hawley uncover a few gems, including a dazzling decanter and an art nouveau picture frame. Presenter Paul Martin also finds time to visit Coniston Water in the Lake District

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from a bustling Southampton to the Isle of Wight, where he rides the island's railway, made up of recycled London Underground trains

programme.title: North Korea: The Insiders
programme.desc: For more than three years, North Korea has sealed its borders. People are banned from leaving or entering the country. Almost every foreigner who was inside has packed up and left. The world's most secretive and tyrannical state is now an information black hole. For months, three people inside North Korea have risked their lives to tell the BBC what is happening. What they reveal is shocking. People starving to death, years of hard labour for those found watching foreign films and TV programmes, and execution for the ones who try to escape. Jean Mackenzie the BBC's correspondent in South Korea asks: is this a new dark age for North Korea? Part of the award winning Our World strand

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson visits Northumberland's Craster to find out how a family who shares the name have had their lives and fortunes intertwined with the village for more than 800 years

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: There is a seabird spectacle from South Stack on Anglesey. A location famed for its dark skies and cliff nesting birds, Gillian Burke explores why it's such a hotspot for wildlife. Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are on fledge watch at RSPB Arne in Dorset, as they are keen to see which of the nests successfully disembarks before the end of the series. And Megan McCubbin returns to RSPB Arne to explore some of its sensational seasonal characters

programme.title: The Gallows Pole
programme.desc: The gang meets up on the day of the heist and Grace is impressed when David gives a strong speech to rally the troops. Then they set to work, targeting the corrupt clothier and stealing the contents of his safe. Meanwhile, David also tries to make amends with Grace, the jilted love of his life. Shane Meadows drama about a gang of 18th-century forgers, starring Michael Socha, Sophie McShera, Ralphi Ineson and Thomas Turgoose

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: On Ireland's south-east coast, the three RNLI crews at Dunmore East, Kilmore Quay and Rosslare battle to save a cargo ship that has lost all power and is drifting towards rocks. In Hoylake, on the Wirral, a vast multi-agency effort is required to rescue a mother and daughter who have got stuck in the mud and, 65 miles to the west, in the coastal village of Porthdinllaen, the crew respond to a mayday call from a yacht five miles out in the Irish Sea that is requesting an immediate medical evacuation

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Jo Whiley and Mark Radcliffe introduce highlights from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, where Radiohead, Foo Fighters and Ed Sheeran were the headliners, including a reminder of some of the big performances, stories and moments from the weekend's events.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a young couple's new glamping business was threatened when their Instagram account was hacked into and taken over. The hacker demanded $500 to hand back control - but they stood their ground. Incidents like this are increasingly common, with more than half of small businesses suffering a cyberattack in the last 12 months. Rav Wilding looks at the work being done by West Midlands Cybercrime Unit to combat the problem

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the woman whose credit rating was ruined after scammers took out multiple mobile phone contracts in her name. She only found out when she tried to apply for a mortgage

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Sutton Coldfield to create an Australian-inspired space to rekindle happy memories for Claire and Andy of their years living in Melbourne

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: After spending all their money buying their first house together, Rory and Holly have no cash left. The team have 24 hours and a minimal budget to transform their home

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to travel by train to more places around the British Isles, beginning by heading to the self-governing Isle of Man - a paradise for rail lovers. His first stop on the Manx Electric Railway is the capital of Douglas, where he reveals the island's parliament the Tynwald is older than Westminster, before the Isle of Man Steam Railway takes him down the east coast to Castletown, from where he heads to the Norse Castle Rusheword

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A criminal couple use an unusual technique to con people at cashpoints. A would-be robber with a knife underestimates an older female cashier, and a bragging joyrider ends up crashing back down to earth. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers travel through France, where they make tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists travel to Leicestershire to pitch ideas to celebrate the buyers' dog. But only two will go on to realise their artworks, before the buyers choose their favourite

programme.title: Animals at Play
programme.desc: Part one of two. The reasons why young animals enjoy playing, and how it can teach them to survive in the wild. The programme explores how young elephants, which rarely leave their mothers' side for the first eight years of life, play to develop social skills, while macaques hone their mental agility by playing games with stones. Plus, a zoologist who looks after orphaned cheetahs reveals how play can help cubs learn to hunt

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein revisit their investigation into a case of murder and mistaken identity, when a woman's body was found among the sand dunes of Great Yarmouth in 1900

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Interesting finds from the show's travels around the country, including a late-19th-century Steiff cow on rollers and a joystick from a First World War aeroplane

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey has brought him to Lee on the Solent in Hampshire and the training centre for the coastguard. He also visits the great maritime city of Portsmouth, and then travels eastwards to Chichester's vast, natural harbour

programme.title: How to Win the Ashes
programme.desc: A look at what it takes to lift the most famous trophy in cricket, featuring stories from the most memorable clashes between England and Australia. Through interviews with cricket stars including Ben Stokes, Jimmy Anderson and Glenn McGrath, this documentary examines the on-field heroics that captured a nation's imagination, and lifts the lid on the behind-the-scenes turmoil, revealing a darker side to the pursuit of success

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: All eyes are on the nests at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Will they fledge before the night is over? Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan look back over the series to see who the main cast of characters have been. Megan McCubbin continues to explore the peripheries of the reserve, and looks at some of its more intriguing inhabitants

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury 2019
programme.desc: Memorable performances from Worthy Farm in Somerset, where artists including Stormzy, George Ezra, Bastille, Sheryl Crow, the Killers, Liam Gallagher, Janet Jackson, the Proclaimers, Kylie Minogue and Miley Cyrus entertained the enthusiastic crowds across the three days of the festival

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: A campaign to warn of birth defects in babies whose mothers take the epilepsy drug sodium valproate while pregnant. Plus, fake medicines being touted as 'cures' for autism

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have overnight news of the key characters being followed in this year's show. Gillian Burke continues her exploration of Snowdonia, looking for the UK's only venomous snake, the adder. Plus, the 81-year-old who has dedicated a decade to building boxes for swifts

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The nests are proving as exciting as ever and Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan indulge viewers with the highlights ahead of the weekend. Gillian Burke travels further north within Snowdonia's National Park to meet a pine marten soon to be released into the wild

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer digs out his rucksack and heads for Windermere in the Lake District. The National Park attracts 18 million visitors each year, and is now a World Heritage site. Here, Paul finds out why the early tourists thought the Lakes was one of the most dangerous spots in the country. He also plunges into the world of long-distance swimming and helps the staff who run the boats on the lake and meets a Holocaust survivor who was airlifted to Windermere in 1945 as part of a mercy mission involving 300 orphans after the Second World War

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: Fred visits the North East, a region rich in transport history, to explore the development of Britain's railways, from the first steam locomotives to the record-breaking Mallard. A visit to York's National Railway Museum offers the chance to ride a replica of Stephenson's Rocket, while at Ffestiniog Railway he learns about the computer-aided design process used for new locomotives

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to donate blood but is aghast to find out how much he has to give. When he discovers he has a rare blood type, he wants to find out where it will end up

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry seek sanctuary from the news so they can watch TV highlights of an England v Bulgaria football match without knowing the result, but they are pursued by the relentless Flint, who has bet them they cannot escape the final score. James Bolam and Rodney Bewes star, with Brian Glover and Donald Gee

programme.title: The Witness Is a Whale
programme.desc: Soviet whaling reports reveal that whales once roamed the oceans in vastly greater numbers than has ever been estimated. This documentary considers how this changes things - if the number of whales was larger, then their role in the ocean was more important than anyone imagined - and how it affects the attempts to save these extraordinary mammals

programme.title: Britain's Wild Places
programme.desc: An insight into the lives of a family of water voles living on the Cromford canal in Derbyshire. The mammals spend their lives in a frenzy of activity, swimming, feeding and breeding, but are on the verge of becoming an endangered species due to poisoning, hunting and the increasing lack of natural living habitats

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present the third round, with the assistance of British soprano Nadine Benjamin, as singers from South Korea, Sweden, China and South Africa perform pieces by Handel, Wagner, Puccini and Mozart in their bid to win a place in Sunday's final

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The story of the influential African musician Fela Kuti, who is remembered not only as the creator of the Afrobeat genre but also as an outspoken political revolutionary who criticised military regimes in his native Nigeria. A counter-cultural revolutionary, he fought injustice with his music and provoked society with his lifestyle, on one occasion marrying 27 wives in a single ceremony. When he died in 1997 from HIV, a disease that carried huge stigma in Africa, there was fear his legacy would die with him, but this film shows that the impact of his life and music is still felt today

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer digs out his rucksack and heads for Windermere in the Lake District. The National Park attracts 18 million visitors each year, and is now a World Heritage site. Here, Paul finds out why the early tourists thought the Lakes was one of the most dangerous spots in the country. He also plunges into the world of long-distance swimming and helps the staff who run the boats on the lake and meets a Holocaust survivor who was airlifted to Windermere in 1945 as part of a mercy mission involving 300 orphans after the Second World War

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: Fred visits the North East, a region rich in transport history, to explore the development of Britain's railways, from the first steam locomotives to the record-breaking Mallard. A visit to York's National Railway Museum offers the chance to ride a replica of Stephenson's Rocket, while at Ffestiniog Railway he learns about the computer-aided design process used for new locomotives

programme.title: The Witness Is a Whale
programme.desc: Soviet whaling reports reveal that whales once roamed the oceans in vastly greater numbers than has ever been estimated. This documentary considers how this changes things - if the number of whales was larger, then their role in the ocean was more important than anyone imagined - and how it affects the attempts to save these extraordinary mammals

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer heads to Derwentwater and Borrowdale, a region of England susceptible to extreme weather, where he meets some of the locals who have battled against flooding and learned to live with the conditions. Along the way, Paul tells the story of Millican Dalton, the 'Professor of Adventure', who ran his own expeditions in the Lake District more than 70 years ago. He also heads for the summit of Great Gable, one of the Lake's best-known peaks

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack recalls the golden age of shipbuilding, examining the skills of engineers who turned Britain into one of the leading manufacturing nations, and visits Bristol to pay tribute to his personal hero Isambard Kingdom Brunel. He also travels to Scotland for a voyage on the paddle steamer Waverley

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: In central Thailand's forests, fertile plains and even its city streets, nature finds a way of living alongside people, and spirituality can be found in human and animal relationships, both likely and unlikely. This bustling region is known as the nation's rice bowl - but even here, there are magical places to be found. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo

programme.title: Lenny Henry's Caribbean Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lenny Henry celebrates his Caribbean-British heritage, and joined by a host of famous faces from the worlds of art, music, entertainment TV and theatre, he examines what it means to be both Caribbean and British today. In the first episode, Lenny looks at the explosion of culture brought from the Caribbean by the post-war arrivals, from the music of calypso and ska, to theatre and art. He explores the stories of activism, entrepreneurship and resilience behind these artforms and how the early cultural pioneers laid the foundations for the next generation

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Three singers have already claimed their place in the final, and tonight the last four performers, from Ukraine, Colombia, Italy and Scotland, compete to join them. At the end of the evening, the judges will also choose a wild card to join tonight's winner in Sunday's final. Presented by Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer heads to Derwentwater and Borrowdale, a region of England susceptible to extreme weather, where he meets some of the locals who have battled against flooding and learned to live with the conditions. Along the way, Paul tells the story of Millican Dalton, the 'Professor of Adventure', who ran his own expeditions in the Lake District more than 70 years ago. programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team investigates the science and engineering helping the UK to blast into space. Chris Lintott visits a rocket company near Glasgow to find out how rockets are built

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred travels to the Lake District, which was once one of Britain's biggest sources of iron ore. He also takes a trip across a lake in a steamboat, examines how the rail industry made use of local metals, and finally enjoys a pint with former steelworkers in a local pub

programme.title: Meet Me in St Louis (1944)
programme.desc: A job offer tempts a banker to consider uprooting his close-knit family and moving to New York. However, his wife and children struggle with the prospect of leaving their friends behind, and are horrified when they realise they might miss out on the 1904 St Louis World's Fair. Meanwhile, teenage daughter Esther faces the abrupt termination of her romance with the boy next door. Musical, starring Judy Garland, Tom Drake and Margaret O'Brien

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures Shorts
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank tries to find the Ark of the Covenant, travelling across Ethiopia in search of the lost relic

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present full coverage of the Song Prize Final. Five singers perform the intimate and demanding discipline of 'art song' or Lieder - and with just a solo singer and piano on stage there really is no place to hide. The judges are Welsh soprano Rosemary Joshua, Argentinian mezzo-soprano Bernarda Fink, accompanist Anna Tilbrook, award-winning composer Errollyn Wallen and chair of the jury John Gilhooly, director of London's Wigmore Hall. Petroc and Josie are joined by Irish soprano Ailish Tynan, who won this competition 20 years ago

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: A quiet January for the amateur cameraman soon turns busy when wild boar become loose in the Devonshire countryside, bringing Britain's media to the area. Johnny also films spoonbills, finding a unique way to get close to the migrating birds

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: Spring proves a busy time for the amateur cameraman, but his mind is elsewhere as his pet deer Bambi falls sick. Johnny rescued the three-legged animal 12 years ago, but her illness leaves him facing a difficult decision

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lola's family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lola's friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? There's a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: First into the Repair Shop is Alison who brings with her an 1890s ventriloquist's puppet called George. The puppet helped Alison grow in confidence and gave her an outlet for her undiagnosed dyslexia as a child but he's now broken both inside and out. Organ-restorer David Burville brings Kirsten Ramsay and the teddy bear ladies to help restore George to his former glory. Lewys from Wales brings in a brass cornet dating back to 1897 that has passed through generations of his family. What once filled his home with music is now completely unplayable, instrument expert Pete Woods gets to work. Nick from Somerset brings in the broken remains of a Roman-style chair that belonged to his late father Richard for upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary to repair. programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: An emergency call comes in to the stroke unit at Bronglais Hospital, Aberystwyth. Issie is growing in confidence in helping stroke patients when they arrive, but is quickly reminded she has a lot to learn and experience to gain. A patient is blue-lighted in to A&E after being knocked off his bike, while Caitlin deals with a patient who has been admitted after having seizures

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, a midwife and her builder husband buy a house which hasn't been lived in for a decade. However, they have big plans to create their forever home for them and their four children. Plus, two houses in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, and Wakefield, West Yorkshire are bought at auction by developers who plan to rent them out. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of new new owners as they bring their plans to fruition

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Single pringle Nash, his sister Yazmin and son Azaad are in the mood for more than just a bingo win because love is in the air. Also hoping that the numbers fall their way are Kelvin and his fiance Linda. This couple have been engaged for five years, but if Kelvin strikes it lucky, might Linda be finally persuaded to set a date? Across the hall and dabbing for gold are '70-something' Jeff and Dave. Both widowers, their blossoming bromance has eased their grief

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

Organ-restorer David Burville brings Kirsten Ramsay and the teddy bear ladies to help restore George to his former glory. programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things explode in the Panesar household as secrets are spilled and rage takes over. Lily is upset with Stacey when she can't afford new trainers and Elaine tries to right her wrongs with Gina and Anna with a girly pamper afternoon

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: First into the Repair Shop is Alison who brings with her an 1890s ventriloquist's puppet called George. The puppet helped Alison grow in confidence and gave her an outlet for her undiagnosed dyslexia as a child but he's now broken both inside and out. Organ-restorer David Burville brings Kirsten Ramsay and the teddy bear ladies to help restore George to his former glory. Lewys from Wales brings in a brass cornet dating back to 1897 that has passed through generations of his family. What once filled his home with music is now completely unplayable, instrument expert Pete Woods gets to work. Nick from Somerset brings in the broken remains of a Roman-style chair that belonged to his late father Richard for upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary to repair. Book-restorer Chris Shaw is tasked with fixing up a notebook that once belonged to Kat's grandmother Mildred in the 1940s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers take on new challenges in Reduce Reuse Recycle week, starting with making a pair of trousers with zero-waste before tackling a mountain of wasted tote bags in the Transformation Challenge. For a Made to Measure outfit, the sewers have been asked to source second-hand crochet blankets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Unreal! with Olivia Neill
programme.desc: TikTok and YouTube star Olivia Neill throws herself into virtual reality, avatar first, to see if she can find love in a digital world. With the help of vlogger Lewys Ball, Olivia embarks on a journey across the UK both physically and virtually to meet companies at the cutting edge of this technology, the real-life people who've not only found love and relationships but found themselves again, and finally tries her hand at dating to see if she can find the next Mr Olivia Neill

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Short comedy film. Two emotionally unassembled young men start a play group, Funboys Fun Club, for childish young men to engage in some wholesome mucking about. When they come across severely depressed 60-year-old Marty, they try their best to bring some joy back to his life

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic modern pentathlon gold medal winner Joe Choong, ex-England rugby League player Jon Wilkin, snowboarder Aimee Fuller and former world squash number one Nick Matthew join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: Simon manages to manipulate David and Michael into working with him again after Lucy teaches him the power of the phrase 'is there a version'

programme.title: Staged
programme.desc: David tries to arrange Georgia's birthday party through a series of favours and the group wonder who will play Scrooge in their upcoming radio play

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A DJ's injury claim hits the deck when online posts show he'd been spinning a tall tale, while a driver who demanded a cash payout after a collision is caught out by her own texts. Plus, investigators uncover the hidden link between a group of strangers claiming thousands of pounds after a car crash

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Care worker Peter lost out on 3,000 when scammers convinced him they were from his bank's fraud team. Jim Browning is the scourge of the scammers working with the police to get them arrested. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, a midwife and her builder husband buy a house which hasn't been lived in for a decade. However, they have big plans to create their forever home for them and their four children. Plus, two houses in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, and Wakefield, West Yorkshire are bought at auction by developers who plan to rent them out. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of new new owners as they bring their plans to fruition

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help two teams look for items at the International Antiques Fair of Wales in Builth Wells, Powys. Charlie Ross visits the National Fencing Musuem

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett has her first driving lesson, Jimmi tries to convince Emma to return to being a forensic medical examiner with the police, while Suni helps a dancing couple get back on their feet

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a drop-leaf table, a pair of legless dining chairs and a collection of unwanted curtains at High Wycombe recycling centre for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a retired couple who want to reconnect with their Scottish roots in Ayrshire. They have a budget of 500,000 and a view over water is a priority. Away from the search, Jonnie also learns about an ancient technique to create salt using sea water and an impressive tower of blackthorn branches

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news from across Northern Ireland, with Tara Mills and Declan Harvey

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vinny gives Suki an ultimatum and Stacey worries about Lily when Amy tells her about the older man who bought her trainers. Tensions are high at Elaine's girly pamper day and Rocky tries to help Kathy get the guests she wants at her wedding

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: Community Life
programme.desc: In Londonderry, Barra Best learns about the group of carers who meet to knit tiny hats for new-born babies at the city's Altnagelvin Hospital. Cate Conway tries her hand at Oval Car Racing with the Ballymoney club enthusiasts, Jo Scott meets the people who've found a place to belong at Belfast's Street Soccer and Anne Marie Wallace proves she's game for a laugh when she takes on the Stand-Up challenge. In the weekly charity appeal, Vinny Hurrell tries his hand at being a guide for the NI Blind Golf Association

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.desc: With the imminent destruction of their home planet approaching, a man and his wife seek to preserve their race by sending their infant son to Earth. Though his extraordinary abilities have led to the adult Clark living on the fringe of society, he is forced to take a stand to protect his adopted home from a fanatical general from his own world, who intends to wipe out the human race. programme.title: Dinner Date

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity special of the classic game show, with contestants Phil Daniels, Steph McGovern and AJ Odudu all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a 50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity

programme.desc: Shelley feels betrayed by her best friend after catching Sunita and Ciaran in a passionate embrace, and Maria gives Toyah a sob story about the man who got her pregnant and why she has decided to have a termination

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Toyah accompanies Maria to the abortion clinic, but will her friend really be able to go ahead with the termination? Back on the Street, Ken comes under fire for helping Ade, and Sunita confronts Shelley

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A nostalgic Stan remembers his first day at the depot, when he was a conductor and Blakey was a driver. He also recounts the events leading to Arthur and Olive's engagement. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Stephen Lewis and Michael Robbins

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Blakey cuts the canteen's opening hours, but when he sacks one of the staff, things really turn nasty. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part one of two. Primrose falls for a roofing contractor, while the twins prove too much of a handful for their school, prompting a trip to view the facilities on offer at Brockhurst College. Nostalgic comedy drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part two of two. The twins abscond from Brockhurst College, but Pop manages to bring them back safe and sound - then lends his services to ensure the boarding school does not have to close. Meanwhile, Primrose makes an unusual request concerning affairs of the heart and Charley launches a bid to buy a local brewery. David Jason stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An investigation into a cattle auctioneer puts Mike's career in danger when he finds himself under suspicion of taking bribes. The case also puts his relationship with his wife in jeopardy, culminating in a final, shocking revelation from Jackie. Meanwhile, Vernon attempts to bottle the secret of eternal youth

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike faces a stressful time as he struggles to cope with his wife's departure, and Tricia offers him a shoulder to cry on, but is beset by problems of her own after prescribing birth control to a 16-year-old. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Tensions flare at the hearing, where Charity's plea of not guilty makes Zoe's blood boil, leading to a confrontation with shocking implications. Marlon feels the pressure and Gloria is unnerved by a rival
