programme.desc: Gloria dredges up all the dirt she can find on Steph, before spreading it around the village, only for the plan to backfire. Charity begs Zoe to confess what she knows, but her pleas fall on deaf ears

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley is nervous as he visits Maxine in the chapel of rest - how will he react to seeing his dead wife laid out ready for burial? Meanwhile, Richard is beginning to crack, while Ken tries to persuade Ade's father to pay him a visit

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: It's an emotional day for Maxine's friends and family as they gather to pay their last respects to her - although for Audrey and Norris, the sad occasion provides a chance for them to get their heads together and try to work out who the killer could be

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James D'Arcy

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part two of two. Carl Lomax's case comes to court, and a local reporter soon rakes up the dirt over Tricia's controversial decision to supply his girlfriend with birth-control drugs. Before long, he escapes from custody and goes on the run with Deborah. Meanwhile, Vernon invests in a new money-making scheme

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield residents are shocked when an MI5 agent turns up in the village showing more than just a passing interest in the activities of Vernon Scripps and his mysterious associate, a man who disembarked from a Russian trawler docked in Whitby harbour. It seems there is an even darker side to the roguish wheeler-dealer than they suspected

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary & Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders' Little Mo)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As Syndicate 9 investigates the discovery of a woman's body in a Manchester hotel room, Gill introduces Rachel to high-flying DS Will Pemberton, unaware they are already well acquainted - they've been having a passionate, secret relationship for months. But while the volatile copper can be discreet when it comes to romance, will she be able to hide her feelings when Gill lets slip that she wasn't the first choice for the sergeant's job? Meanwhile, Janet is keen to give her own love life a boost, especially after seeing how happy Ade is with his new partner Eleanor. However, a speed-dating event might not be the best option, as Janet finds herself treating each brief encounter like a police interrogation. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Amelia Bullmore, Steve Touissant and Mina Anwar

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Unable to get used to the fact she was second choice for the sergeant's job, Rachel punishes Janet for keeping the truth from her, and although Will cheers her up with the news she has been chosen for a vice initiative, the detective is soon stung by Gill's harsh words. Meanwhile, an unconscious baby is admitted to hospital with injuries that do not match his parents' explanation of events, and when an unregistered childminder and her boyfriend enter the equation, it's unclear who had the boy's best interests at heart

programme.desc: Richard is heartened when it becomes clear that no one believes Audrey's wild accusations, while Ashley receives the phone call he's been dreading. Ciaran gives Roy his ideas for expanding the cafe and Kevin hears an interesting piece of gossip about Craig Nelson.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's staff come under suspicion when some African carvings are stolen from the hall - but then an African chieftain arrives claiming the very same pieces belong to his tribe. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Rupert Vansittart and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: A spate of petty thefts is traced to a local nursing home, but Blaketon's investigations uncover something far more sinister. Meanwhile, David's first day in his new job goes spectacularly wrong, but Bernie is not surprised. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective is faced with a difficult case when he investigates the discovery of a body in a well, and he also has to contend with a new boss, Chief Superintendent Moody, who is dubious as to Lewis' motivation for coming out of retirement. As investigations into the human remains in the well proceed, an avant-garde artist's body is also discovered and at first glance it looks like a tragic drugs overdose, but Hathaway and Lewis quickly recognise the tell tale signs of murder

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel can't get Gill's remarks about her fling with Will out of her head, so ducks out of attending an awards ceremony with him, fearing their colleagues will believe she's sleeping her way to the top. He finally decides that dating her is too much like hard work and so announces they are no longer an item - a move that leaves Rachel gutted and regretting her behaviour. Janet isn't happy either - it's clear her daughter Elise is about to have her heart broken by Eleanor's son Ade. The duo are soon distracted from their woes by a new case involving the murder of a landlord and his wife who were shot at close range in their pub

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet voices her concerns to Dodson about Gill's drinking, hoping it can be dealt with amicably, so she's unnerved when her observations are taken more seriously than she intended. Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated

programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victim's apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ashfordly Hall throws open its doors to the public, but all hell breaks loose when a collection of valuable Constable sketches is stolen. Mike and Tom are sent to question the chief suspect, an 80-year-old art thief, only to find him mugged and bound to a chair - with none of the paintings anywhere in sight. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr and Ryan Early

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A prodigal son returns to claim his inheritance, setting off alarm bells for Ventress, whose instinct is confirmed when a series of accidents at the carpet factory signals the management's scant regard for life and limb. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps spies an opportunity to make merry as well as money by organising a beauty pageant, but reckons without the determined opposition of disapproving Joyce Jowett, who will stop at nothing to halt the event

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joe's home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The discovery of slaves on the Pritchard farm has turned a murder inquiry into a multi-agency operation. The enormity of the case brings Dodson to Syndicate 9, keen to establish Gill's state of mind and efficacy as senior officer. Having been the driver involved in the fatal collision with Cal Pritchard, Janet is under investigation and unable to interview the man's widow Evie. Devastated by the consequences of her actions, the detective eventually finds solace in Chris's calm and kind reasoning, but when an incandescent Evie smells alcohol on Gill's breath, she has all the ammunition she needs to discredit the case and bring the DCI down

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: When elderly teacher Peter Farquhar was found dead at home in the village of Maids Moreton in 2015, it was sad and unexpected, but no one thought it suspicious. But 18 months later, when his neighbour Ann Moore-Martin also fell ill and died, the police decided to look again. They found that Ben Field, a would-be vicar and academic, had recently become part of both of their lives and benefited from their wills. This programme shows that by delving back in time through friends' and loved ones' memories of Peter and Ben's relationship, as well as Peter's diary, the police discovered a story of love and betrayal

programme.desc: Once again, matre d' Fred Sirieix plays Cupid at the Manchester restaurant. First to arrive is 36-year-old, larger-than-life stand-up comedian Mani. Despite his confidence on stage, he's yet to find a strong, independent Pakistani Muslim woman he can settle down with off stage. His match is 30-year-old nursing home owner Natasha, whose quick wit and dry sense of humour seem set to give Mani a run for his money. Twenty nine-year-old hairdresser Scott has a history of relationships being cut short. Phil managed to find one with a cat flap already installed for 25,000 under-budget, now he visits them at a different property to find they have upsized in more ways than one. Kirstie met Steph and Nick in 2018 who were looking to buy their first home together after seven years of living in their own parents houses. The pair then head to the Lingholm Estate to stay in a unique boathouse that floats over a wild and stormy Derwentwater and go for a very choppy boat ride. programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody

Ben Hillman tracks down five properties within their budget of 140,000, hoping that at least one will find favour with the couple

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson heads to the glorious Greek island of Crete to help Jeanette and Phil, who are dreaming of starting a new, relaxed way of life in the sunshine while spending more quality time together. They're focusing their search around the beautiful, ancient city of Chania and ideally want a three-bedroom detached house with a pool. They have allocated a budget of 170,000, so Jean hunts out five properties for them to consider

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Jodie wants to start a small horse livery business and also explores how to start up a kids' club on her family's smallholding. Sarah Beeny follows her progress

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Charlie is caught red handed by DS Zoe and lands himself behind bars. Meanwhile, Grace and Zara are worried when they struggle to locate Cindy

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: After spending the night in police custody, Charlie is let off with a caution. Elsewhere, Maxine and Zoe come face to face with Sam, and Cindy confronts Grace

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The remaining seven chefs are tasked to produce an extravagant dish using the finest ingredients money can buy. Exorbitant price tags and the world's rarest delicacies abound as the chefs compete to appeal to the Langham hotel's millionaire clientele. Those who fail to impress undertake a second challenge in a fight for survival. To prove their business acumen, they must devise a 30 lunch menu and run a busy Langham lunch service. Tension overflows in the kitchen and the chef who brings in the least profit is eliminated. Michel Roux Jr, Ravneet Gill and Mike Reid judge their efforts

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering 29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Concluding the investigation into the 1994 murder of six-year-old Rikki Neave. Fifteen years after Rikki's mother was cleared of his murder following a flawed police investigation, a team of dedicated officers from the Major Crime Unit of Cambridgeshire police were authorised to begin a fresh investigation. Analysis of the evidence put a new suspect, James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, together with Rikki on the day of his disappearance. But despite a forensic breakthrough, Watson presented the officers with a conundrum that made it difficult to prove the case against him

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: Untold: Addicted to Drip
programme.desc: A lifestyle traditionally associated with ultra-high-net-worth individuals is increasingly being pursued by 16 to 34-year-olds. Exclusive figures reveal that almost half of younger Brits have gone into debt after purchasing a luxury item. Presenter and comedian David Whitely, aka Sideman, meets people who've lost tens of thousands in the pursuit of luxury. However, while the need to be stylish or fashionable (that is having the 'drip') is getting some into financial trouble, he finds that for others it is opening doors

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of deadly wildfires in Paradise, California, that wiped out homes, towns and lives, telling the stories of the emergency responders and those who escaped. Plus, the outrageous act of white supremacist Dylann Roof, who armed with a gun, entered Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, South Carolina, to launch a racially motivated attack. Emergency calls from inside the church reveal the harrowing events that unfolded

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: Ed Stafford heads to the Easterhouse estate, six miles east of Glasgow city centre, and discovers that the cost-of-living crisis has hit the locals hard. The city has seen high levels of drug abuse over the years and Ed meets the locals who are living with the effects of it daily. A young man who got hooked on cocaine aged just 14 nearly died of an overdose. Thanks to rehab and the support of his family, he's swapped cocaine for boxing and is enroute to becoming a professional athlete

programme.title: Kids
programme.desc: As they approach adulthood, Havana and Kane try to make sense of their pasts. programme.title: Jay Blades' East End Through Time
programme.desc: Jay Blades explores the fascinating history of London's East End, from the Shoreditch site where Shakespeare performed, to the story of the original Jack the Lad. He starts where London's East End begins, by the Roman city wall, to hear how East of the wall became a place for 'outsiders' in the 1500s, where immoral or forbidden activities would take place like gambling and bear baiting. Heading to St Dunstan's Church in Stepney, Jay discovers how the Great Plague in 1665 devastated the East End's population due to poor living conditions, and is spooked by the fact that thousands of plague victim's bodies still lie in the church's grounds

programme.title: HMP Full Sutton: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Full Sutton, a men's high security prison in the East Riding of Yorkshire which has been home to some of Britain's most notorious criminals, including serial killer Dennis Nilsen, the Manchester gangster Dale Cregan, and, the so-called railway rapist and serial killer David Mulcahy. The programme reveals the story of a shocking one-man riot at Full Sutton in 2018. and also shares stories from the prison's Beast Wing, where sex offenders are locked up and separated from the other inmates

Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots are driven into hiding when the human race turns against them. When rediscovered by a kindly inventor and his daughter, they come out of exile to save the world, battling a new breed of human-created Transformers. These deadly new machines were created to hunt them down, but are now growing independent and intend to make use of technology from the Transformers' home planet in a plot that could threaten all life on Earth. Fourth film in the sci-fi adventure series, starring Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: White House Down (2013)
programme.desc: A policeman is turned down for his dream job as a secret service bodyguard to the president. While taking his daughter on a tour of the White House, he gets the chance to prove himself when terrorists seize control of the building, putting the head of state's life in his hands. Action thriller, with Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon (2016)
programme.desc: An oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico is beset by technical difficulties - but executives from the company behind the project ignore the signs and demand work proceeds as normal, despite warnings from key engineers on site. The situation rapidly gets out of control, leading to the worst environmental disaster in US history. Fact-based drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kurt Russell and John Malkovich

programme.title: Benjamin (2018)
programme.desc: An up-and-coming filmmaker tries to balance a romance with a visiting French music student and the release of his second movie. A lot of time has elapsed since his acclaimed debut and Benjamin is concerned that his follow-up will be a disaster. Writer/director Simon Amstell's comedy drama, starring Colin Morgan, Jack Rowan and Anna Chancellor, with cameos from Mark Kermode and Simon Mayo

programme.title: The Desperados (1969)
programme.desc: A sadistic Confederate preacher leads his family on a campaign of violence and destruction during the American Civil War, but one of his three sons rejects them to lead a peaceful life under an assumed identity. Years after the conflict, the outcast is confronted by his villainous relatives once more as they cause mayhem in his new home town. Western, starring Jack Palance, Vince Edwards, George Maharis, Sylvia Syms and Kate O'Mara

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan

programme.title: Bugles in the Afternoon (1952)
programme.desc: A disgraced cavalryman tries to redeem himself by returning to active service at a fort in the middle of Sioux territory, unaware the commanding officer is an arch-enemy from the past. Antagonism grows as they both fall for the same woman, and the newcomer finds himself assigned to ever more dangerous missions by his commander, who hopes he will fail to return from them. Western, with Ray Milland, Helena Carter and Hugh Marlowe

programme.title: El Dorado (1966)
programme.desc: An ageing gunfighter is drawn into the conflict between a land-grabbing cattle baron and a ranching family, but gets wounded in the process. A year later, he returns to town to find the situation has not improved - so along with his sidekick and the drunken town sheriff, he fights to defend the family from its enemies. Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Mile 22 (2018)
programme.desc: A team of American intelligence officers, part of a top-secret tactical command unit, attempt to smuggle a police officer with sensitive information out of Indonesia. Thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Lauren Cohan

programme.title: The Italian Job (2003)
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Birds of Passage (2018)
programme.desc: In Colombia, Rapayet and his indigenous family get involved in a war to control the business that ends up destroying their lives and culture. Drama, starring Jose Acosta and Natalia Reyes

programme.title: The Swimmer (1968)
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by swimming in the neighbourhood pools along the way. Director Frank Perry's cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1959)
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson are asked to protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskerville family, who is believed to be the target of a monstrous spectral hound roaming the remote Devon moors. Hammer version of Arthur Conan Doyle's mystery, starring Peter Cushing, Andre Morrell, Christopher Lee, John Le Mesurier and Miles Malleson

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: Olympus Has Fallen (2013)
programme.desc: A secret service operative is reassigned from Presidential Protection after a tragic accident. As he prepares to leave his assignment, terrorists take control of the White House and hold the president hostage. The agent is trapped in the building, and uses his inside knowledge to rescue the head of state. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Anais In Love (2021)
programme.desc: Anas is an aspiring writer who's procrastinating on completing her doctorate. She's had it with her boyfriend, so she barges into an affair with publisher Daniel. And when that disappoints her, she moves on to his partner, writer Emilie. Romantic comedy drama, starring Anas Demoustier. In French, with English subtitles

programme.title: Can You Ever Forgive Me? (2018)
programme.desc: While suffering financial troubles, writer Lee Israel starts forging and selling letters by dead celebrities, incorporating intimate details to command high prices. She also starts stealing authentic letters from libraries and archives to sell, replacing them with forged duplicates. Comedy, starring Oscar nominees Melissa McCarthy and Richard E Grant

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Nadira makes a heartbreaking discovery, Tom has to have a difficult conversation with his daughter, and Warren proves that he has a sensitive side

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yazz opens up to Peri about her doubts, Joel tried to take Leela's mind off things, and Ella longs to find her real dad

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Arvada, Colorado, where a husband and wife have allowed their restaurant to fall into disrepair. Randy's hoarding is out of control, while Alexa, who runs the kitchen, has a lot to learn. To make matters worse, the Old Neighborhood is one of the filthiest eateries the fiery chef has ever seen, and only one of the biggest transformations of the series can save the business

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Unfortunately, the row brings up unpleasant memories for Sheldon of watching his warring parents, causing even more tension between the friends. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: Modern Family

Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin receives an unconventional birthday gift involving his dad, so Dave suggests they spend the day celebrating in a way that honors the late Butler father

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay switches sides after joining Cam's bowling team, while Phil and Claire see a different side to their neighbours. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Dr Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins. but Mary is unhappy when the test results go to Sheldon's head. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Jonnie Irwin lines up five properties for their 130,000 budget, hoping he has found one that delivers the views and proximity to coast that the pair are dreaming of

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: There is a new arrival at the alpaca farm in France, security problems plague the padel tennis club in Spain while the pool finally has water at the rock 'n' roll B&B

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners, turning items into hard cash. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this edition

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: In Kent, the house clearance of a retired lathe operator uncovers a large family, but surname changes don't add up and illegitimate births mean many won't be entitled. Delving deeper into the family tree, missing family records reveal two sister war brides who married their GI sweethearts but had a fight on their hands to be reunited with them on the other side of the Atlantic

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The competition is on as the team endeavour to crack a new treasury case before a rival firm gets there first. With family lines leading nowhere, the team's research takes an interesting tack when records lead to India

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe, owned by Martin and Hannah Weaver. However, visitors Rob and Michelle from Seashells B&B find a condom by the entrance and Clare and Fran from The New Court Hotel are concerned about cleanliness. Tom and Samara from The Crown at Whitchurch think the rooms are little more than functional. Martin and Hannah try to impress their guests at breakfast by introducing them to their pet pig, but there are issues with eggs, but some harsh feedback disappoints the pair

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores after being offended by some of the feedback they have received

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

programme.title: The Dog House

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Bolton-based bricklayer Paul Rimmer, who has spent his career restoring and renovating Victorian terrace houses, sets his sights on constructing a state-of-the-art home on a budget of 350,000. However, instead of using the construction materials he has spent the past 40 years mastering, he has opted to build his new home from wood. Roping in his wife Carol, daughter Abby and a selection of favoured workmates, Paul and his team begin work on the ultra-modern, five-bedroom build, and Kevin McCloud reveals how extreme weather, exhaustion, and rapidly dwindling funds place the entire project in jeopardy

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

A man who collapsed suddenly is suspected of having a life-threatening head injury, while a four-year-old girl needs treatment after falling on an escalator

programme.title: Baby Surgeons: Delivering Miracles
programme.desc: Three expectant mothers face dangerous complications in their pregnancies, and have to decide whether they are willing to undergo pioneering but potentially risky surgery for a successful birth. A woman carrying triplets shows signs of a rare blood condition that can cause miscarriages, another mother's foetus has become entangled in the lining of the womb and risks losing a foot, and a woman who is 36 weeks pregnant discovers that her baby has fluid building up in its brain

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Scottish Dr Andrew has a problem being understood, but the soon-to-be-Aussie has bigger issues with a young footballer showing signs of spinal and internal injuries after a hard tackle. Dr Mya finds herself juggling patients like they're balls in the air

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

Danni Menzies has five options lined up for Kim's 50,000 budget, but are any of them the perfect place for her and her family?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including stained glass and a Victorian hay rack that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The death of a pathologist leads probate detectives to a family torn apart by tuberculosis. Plus, the search for the son of a deceased man who served in the Royal Army Medical corps, helping the wounded on the frontline of battle

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: In Hatfield, Hertfordshire, a researcher struggles to find any clues from neighbours about a retired factory worker whose father survived a First World War PoW camp

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Chris Foster and his German companion Christel Richter are floored by the London prices, and Ursula Beswick and Daria Pakalnicka question the quality of the facilities. Despite So and Kevin's best efforts to charm their guests, a dinner conversation leaves Kris Malde and Vikki Cheatham making accusations of sexism and So and Kevin are outraged by some of their feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris Foster and Christel Richter invite the hoteliers to Ann's Farmhouse in the suburbs of Bradford, West Yorkshire, but tensions remain high between So, Kevin, Kris and Vikki

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the R Inn in Desborough, Northamptonshire. The establishment is owned by entrepreneur Kris Malde, who's helped by events manager Vikki Cheetham. Kris opened the hotel to add corporate-style rooms for his events space next door. Ursula and Daria think the facilities are lacking and when the simmering tensions between So and Kevin and Kris and Vikki boil over at dinner, So refuses to stay the night. Chris and Christel reject the coffee at breakfast, and Kris and Vikki face some tough feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the last time, bones of contention include a missing biscuit, marks on a toilet seat and one guest is confronted about why they refused to stay the night. There are harsh words and home truths before the overall winner is revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick and Angel expand the project by setting up a luxury campsite on the chateau grounds, but they only have six weeks to complete it before the first guests arrive - and the weather is not on their side, with constant rain turning the planned site into a muddy field. They also have to contend with a visit from Dick's family at Easter

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic

programme.title: Fortress Britain with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: The historian explores the story of Britain's obsession with invasion through history, joined by Professor Danielle George and Dr Onyeka Nubia. The first episode examines the surviving traces of Henry VIII's fear of invasion from Catholic Europe. Alice gets her hands on a vast hoard of Tudor coins and a 500-year-old jousting scorecard, as she learns how Henry's greed and ambition led him to bankrupt the nation and lay the foundations for the modern secret service

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary presenting real-life footage of challenging situations in the workplace, from dangerous encounters in late-night takeaways and corner shops, to messy jobs and tyrannical bosses. The programme features contributions from the employees featured and analysis from psychologists on the anxieties that can influence behaviour in a working environment

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 92-year-old man may have a bleed on the brain after falling and hitting his head, so is sent for a CT scan. programme.desc: In France, the alpaca farmers take the herd to a chateau and the gtes get their first guests. In Spain, the padel tennis club flourishes and in Italy, a project nears completion

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a handsome profit for their owners. Simon recycles some historic oak, while Henry comes unstuck when he tries to get to grips with an old Ford Escort

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A search in Lancashire uncovers a family hero who flew Wellington bombers during the First World War, and investigators stumble across a mysterious disappearance from the 1960s

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The home of a retired lift attendant from Leeds goes under the hammer at auction and the team are hoping for a good profit to pass on to any heirs they can find. As they unravel the family tree, they discover that one of her grandfathers rose from groom to coachman to chauffeur as horse-driven vehicles were replaced by turn-of-the-century mechanisation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Falmouth, Cornwall, where Gaye Woods hopes her family run Meudon Hotel will win the day. However, guests Tim and Mikey think their twin beds are too close for comfort. For some afternoon fun, Gaye lays on some oyster shucking. At dinner, some of the group are unconvinced by the high room rates and at breakfast, guests Sue and Chris reveal a picky streak. When Gaye receives her feedback, she's left wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Royal Oak pub in Malborough, Devon, run by laid-back owner Tim Heap, with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. The basic rooms are a hit with some guests, but Geoff and Joan discover a mucky corner cupboard. Tim and Mikey take the group to an art workshop for some creative fun. At dinner, the guests are itching to know more about Tim's past and he doesn't disappoint, but he's riled when Gaye questions his unconventional management style. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, some tough feedback makes Tim suspicious

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Angel Guest House in Tiverton, Devon, where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience. Gaye is concerned by the noise of the road outside, and Joan and Geoff question some design choices in their room. During an afternoon playing a local game known as Throw the Egg, the group rumbles how competitive their hosts are. At dinner, Tim's enthusiasm results in an unexpected gift. Egg connoisseur Chris's poached eggs are put to the test at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan's Compton Swan in Newbury, Berkshire. Expectations are high after Joan revealed she was named Ireland's Businesswoman of the Year on the last visit, but Tim, who's still smarting from his feedback, goes to town on his room. Tensions mount during an afternoon on an inflatable racecourse, where Chris and Sue try to sabotage the race. Geoff and Joan impress with a harpist at dinner and hearts are softened when they reveal the personal sacrifices they make for their business. At breakfast, Geoff the chef impresses, but egg-man Chris takes issues with his food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel transforms the attic into a studio and storage space for her vintage treasures and takes Dorothy on a trip to Paris, while Dick has his own plans for repurposing some ancient tools he finds in the outbuildings. The couple throws a surprise birthday celebration for Angel's mother, where Dick's purpose-built open-fire popcorn maker is put to the test

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Lonesome teenager Jasmine seeks a canine companion to replace her twin sister Shola, who's leaving her to start a university course. Her family thinks that pedigree beagle Zoe will make the perfect new sibling, but Jasmine isn't so sure. Elsewhere, staff of Woodgreen animal charity believe Jim the poodle could prove the perfect match for 12-year-old Lexi, who is looking for a 'bedtime buddy'

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Mark and Candida Diacono, who have set about building a home in the shape of a plough on their 17-acre smallholding in Devon. With its complex curved roof, timber-clad exterior and steel-framed working barn, the ambitious project presents a unique technical challenge for a local builder and his team of employees, and the task proves even more intimidating when considering Mark and Candida hope to complete work on the build within seven months

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis heads a team excavating back gardens around Britain. Joined by archaeological scientist and lecturer at Newcastle University Dr Chloe Duckworth, field archaeologist Natasha Bilson, and author and archaeologist John Henry Phillips, he reveals a new chapter of Roman history in Cornwall, at a recently discovered Roman fort near Calstock. Little was previously known about the Romans in this part of England, but the indications from the team's excavation are that the Romans were not in the south west solely for a military campaign. Hugh also visits the reconstructed Lunt Roman Fort in Coventry

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke visits Three Ways Farm near Stockport, which has been in Gordon's family since the 1950s. His late mother's dream was for Gordon to turn the 120-year-old cattle shed and milking parlour into a home for himself, so he and partner Lisa have set out to make that a reality, creating their first home together. Will it end up being something his mother would have been proud of?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A teenager has a life-threatening bleed on the brain and requires emergency surgery, a 10-year-old gymnast sustains an injury to her wrist after performing a back bend, and a girl is brought in to the urgent care centre, needing treatment for her swollen tonsils. As they undergo treatment, their parents share stories of family life

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis heads a team excavating back gardens around Britain. Joined by archaeological scientist and lecturer at Newcastle University Dr Chloe Duckworth, field archaeologist Natasha Bilson, and author and archaeologist John Henry Phillips, he reveals a new chapter of Roman history in Cornwall, at a recently discovered Roman fort near Calstock. Little was previously known about the Romans in this part of England, but the indications from the team's excavation are that the Romans were not in the south west solely for a military campaign. Hugh also visits the reconstructed Lunt Roman Fort in Coventry

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep into the Black Forest, where he discovers how Hansel and Gretel helped to unify the German nation. A masterclass in carving cuckoo clocks demonstrates how the nation's reputation for quality and reliability in manufacturing was established. Later, at Goettingen University, the former politician discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century - the duelling fraternities and the ground-breaking scientists who laid the foundation of Germany's world-class transport technology

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across Ireland, travelling from Navan to Mullingar. Along the way, he gets up to speed with modern archaeology in County Meath, where he uncovers a controversial Victorian dig at the sacred Hill of Tara. Later, he investigates leaping salmon in Leixslip, and in Mullingar, bangs the drum for the town's traditional marching band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Cornwall's county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by professional plant hunters commissioned by its owner. The Atlantic Coast branch line carries Michael north to Newquay, where he discovers a pioneering surfer and braves the waves on a belly board. In the nearby village of St Mawgan, Michael is introduced to the ancient Cornish sport of 'wrassling', which surged in popularity between the wars as part of a Cornish Celtic revival

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory in rural Somerset that produces one million pots of yoghurt every 24 hours, and meets the herd of cows that produce the milk. Cherry Healey helps out with the UK's biggest blackcurrant harvest and tries out plant-based alternatives to milk, while historian Ruth Goodman reveals the stories behind the electric milk float and the cream tea

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the world's first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the country's most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought

programme.title: Bangers & Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team snap up a slightly saggy 1970s Saab 96, but despite a stunning restoration, could it result in a record financial loss when it goes to auction?

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Cornwall's county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by professional plant hunters commissioned by its owner. The Atlantic Coast branch line carries Michael north to Newquay, where he discovers a pioneering surfer and braves the waves on a belly board. In the nearby village of St Mawgan, Michael is introduced to the ancient Cornish sport of 'wrassling', which surged in popularity between the wars as part of a Cornish Celtic revival

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog

programme.title: Forbidden History

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo traces the early 20th-century roots of the Spanish Civil War, which divided his family and sent his father into exile. The former politician discovers a nation fractured at the time by social tensions and regional loyalties, which today offer a rich diversity of cultures to delight the tourist. After arriving in Majorca from Barcelona, Michael spoils himself enjoying spectacular scenic views aboard a 1912 vintage railway and a 1913 tram. He also gets trampled underfoot at the bottom of a Catalan 'people steeple' and learns to make the perfect paella

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of Michael Portillo's long journey from Wexford to Westport, a fashionable Victorian seaweed bath is followed by a steamy scene in Ballina. On tenterhooks in Foxford, Michael discovers the visionary charity of an entrepreneurial nun, learns of a double tragedy at Clew Bay and begins a pilgrimage to the summit of Croagh Patrick, Ireland's holy mountain

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on train journeys through Edwardian Britain, exploring the grand estates of Norfolk and a bivouac on Brownsea Island on the way. He also learns the ropes aboard an Edwardian wherry on the Norfolk Broads

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads out to pick up a pair of beautiful Swedish models - a Saab 96L and a Volvo P1800ES. Plus, a rare British AC Aceca comes up for sale

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain. Out on the rugged moor, Michael hears how the celebrated author Daphne du Maurier captivated readers between the wars with her tales of smuggling at the Jamaica Inn. In Devon, Michael takes the plunge at Plymouth's beautiful art deco Tinside Lido, while at Ivybridge, he boards a vehicle like no other to cross the causeway to Burgh Island, where a 1930s playboy built a splendid art deco party palace

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's exploration of the West Country continues in south Devon. He arrives in Paignton to investigate an extraordinarily high murder rate in the literature of the 1930s. The Dartmouth Steam Railway conveys him in style to the beautiful home of Agatha Christie, in the company of her great-grandson, James Prichard

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace, Cherry Healey and Ruth Goodman explore the fascinating factory processes and surprising history behind the nation's favourite festive treats. Gregg follows 24 hours of production at a factory in Oldham, Greater Manchester, which will be making two million Christmas cakes for Marks and Spencer, while Cherry visits Britain's largest marzipan manufacturer as well as a sprout farm. Ruth investigates how the UK's early industrial heritage inspired Charles Dickens to write A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania to the shores of the Black Sea. Along the way he encounters a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia, striking oil in Ploiesti, tapping into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loading cargo from a crane in Constanta. This leg of his journey ends at Constanta, where Michael explores what is now emerging as Europe's largest grain port

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores an Edwardian utopia in Letchworth, where he meets a fourth generation citizen who introduces him to the town's community spirit. He then heads towards London, and discovers a favoured haunt of King Edward VII, before sampling the monarch's favourite tipple, the King's Ginger

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: Bangers & Cash

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the county line from Devon into Somerset, seeing first-hand how willow farmers sought to overcome the challenge from the production of synthetic plastics during the 1930s and hearing how tourism has spread across the region, especially amongst the young. In Bath, Michael visits the former home of a refugee emperor, whose country was invaded by the Italian dictator Mussolini, and in whose name a religious movement began that now flourishes worldwide. Travelling east into Wiltshire, he reaches the largest training area of the British Army, Salisbury Plain

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England in the inter-war period, starting in Canterbury, Kent, where he treads the boards as he uncovers the political message behind a 1936 play, inspired by the 12th-century murder of Archbishop Thomas a Becket. In Maidstone, he learns of the international origins of the most British symbol of remembrance. Outside Sevenoaks, Michael visits the country home of Winston Churchill, and discovers how the 1930s were wilderness years at Chartwell, as Churchill warned against Nazi appeasement. Once in the capital, he heads to Alexandra Palace, the birthplace of television

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer

programme.title: Titanic (1997)

She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Davina McCall's Pill Revolution
programme.desc: In recent years use of the contraceptive pill has reduced, while natural family planning methods have grown in popularity. On social media women are speaking out about side-effects they've put up with as a consequence of putting synthetic hormones into their bodies. Concerned about the choices that are available to her daughters and their friends, Davina investigates the myths and misconceptions that surround contraception and reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey that asked over 4,000 women and people assigned female at birth about the effects of contraception on their mental and physical health

programme.title: Sarah Beeny Vs Cancer
programme.desc: The presenter explores breast cancer treatment in the UK, with filming starting on her first day of treatment, three weeks after her initial diagnosis. The programme also captures the experiences of her husband and children, charting the impact a cancer treatment can have on a whole family, and also follows Sarah as she reflects on her mother's death from the same condition 40 years previously

programme.desc: Tax officer and vegetarian Bijal Mehta hosts the final night of the competition in Southampton, and hopes to create the ultimate meat-free dinner - but some of her guests are disappointed by the menu. Following the meal, the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with two sets of first time buyers who took on the market with their help. Elly and Paul from Bristol enlisted Phil's help in 2015 in their hunt for a period home with two double bedrooms, a bit of character and some outside space for future cats. Phil managed to find one with a cat flap already installed for 25,000 under-budget, now he visits them at a different property to find they have upsized in more ways than one. Kirstie met Steph and Nick in 2018 who were looking to buy their first home together after seven years of living in their own parents houses. With hopes of finding a futureproof home for them to settle in to, Kirstie found them a property in Dennyloanhead that was perfect for them to make their own, she returns to find out just how that went

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian Judi Love for a tour of the Lake District as they stay in the best staycation hideaways they can find. Starting at the Gaia Farmhouse by Ullswater, Judi enjoys the sights and sounds of the season and Sandi feels the heat when Judi cooks an exceedingly spicy take on cottage pie. The pair then head to the Lingholm Estate to stay in a unique boathouse that floats over a wild and stormy Derwentwater and go for a very choppy boat ride. The adventure concludes on the banks of Windermere in Grey Gables where Sandi and Judi unwind with some wine-time and homemade watercolour postcards

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering 29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Concluding the investigation into the 1994 murder of six-year-old Rikki Neave. Fifteen years after Rikki's mother was cleared of his murder following a flawed police investigation, a team of dedicated officers from the Major Crime Unit of Cambridgeshire police were authorised to begin a fresh investigation. Analysis of the evidence put a new suspect, James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, together with Rikki on the day of his disappearance. But despite a forensic breakthrough, Watson presented the officers with a conundrum that made it difficult to prove the case against him

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: When elderly teacher Peter Farquhar was found dead at home in the village of Maids Moreton in 2015, it was sad and unexpected, but no one thought it suspicious. But 18 months later, when his neighbour Ann Moore-Martin also fell ill and died, the police decided to look again. They found that Ben Field, a would-be vicar and academic, had recently become part of both of their lives and benefited from their wills. This programme shows that by delving back in time through friends' and loved ones' memories of Peter and Ben's relationship, as well as Peter's diary, the police discovered a story of love and betrayal

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: Ed Stafford heads to the Easterhouse estate, six miles east of Glasgow city centre, and discovers that the cost-of-living crisis has hit the locals hard. The city has seen high levels of drug abuse over the years and Ed meets the locals who are living with the effects of it daily. A young man who got hooked on cocaine aged just 14 nearly died of an overdose. Thanks to rehab and the support of his family, he's swapped cocaine for boxing and is enroute to becoming a professional athlete

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe's big day arrives, but wedding planner Monica and stand-in father of the bride Joey take their roles a little too seriously. To make matters worse, a blizzard hits New York and one of Mike's ushers is indisposed, forcing Ross and Chandler to step into the breach

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey persuades Phoebe to teach him French for an important audition, while Monica and Chandler show a pregnant Erica the sights of New York and learn more about the baby's possible father. Guest starring Anna Faris and Ron Leibman

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel heads to a restaurant for a job interview, only to find herself sitting at a table within earshot of her current boss. Meanwhile, Monica and Chandler go house-hunting and Phoebe decides to change her name. Guest starring Paul Rudd and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in York are forced into one of their most dangerous pursuits after a report of a stolen car travelling at recklessly high speeds towards the city centre. A lone cop in the Dales at night urgently needs back-up to prevent a dangerous speeding drunk who is determined to flee, while police receive a tip-off claiming a man drove home from a pub drunk after refusing to pay his bill

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A prolific car thief with a string of convictions under his belt crashes and rolls a stolen car at over 100mph, while in Harrogate the hunt for a cloned car and disqualified driver leads to a high-speed pursuit. The suspect leaps from the moving car and leaves it driverless, heading downhill straight towards a busy main road during the rush hour

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ortis Deley follows officers from Cleveland and Durham's specialist unit as they embark on a series of operations targeting crimes connected to narcotics. From chasing down people driving under the influence of drugs to raiding cannabis factories, Sgt Kevin Salter and his crew take on the drug game's key players in the north-east of England. Showcasing all the action of one eventful night, Ortis is in the thick of it as the interceptors ultimately seize more than 500,000 of contraband

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The work of Cheshire's high-speed police interception unit, whose patch is one of the UK's most affluent areas. In the first edition, Tom tries to stop a suspected petrol thief who is not willing to pull over, Bucko and Chris meet a mouthy driver who refuses to come quietly, Mike helps to carry out a textbook tactical pursuit and containment, and Jim deals with a drunk, foul-mouthed racist who has bladder-control issues

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Gordo and Dan use their Tasers to help arrest a knife-wielding teenager, Jim leads five units in the boxing in of a car suspected of carrying drugs, and Tim and Tom tackle a mouthy drunk who has crashed his van

programme.title: Call the Bailiffs: Time to Pay Up
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of enforcement agents as they execute High Court writs on behalf of people desperate to recover money they are owed

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Marilyn wants out, Eden's song is a hit, Remi has big ideas for Lyrik, and Mali takes pity on John's revamp

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Kirby loses her song-writing mojo, and it remains to be seen whether Marilyn has what it takes to fight a powerful corporation. Lyrik might be hijacking Bree and Remi's romance

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The medics explore the theory that a 'broken heart' can cause patients to suffer very real mental and physical problems. Dr Wyne chats to Adolphus, who is struggling to come to terms with the recent death of his wife and best friend within a few weeks of each other. Dr Qamar pays a home visit to Elsie, a sprightly octogenarian whose health has deteriorated since the death of her husband, while Dr Razak treats young Emily, who has inherited a rare genetic condition from her late father which weakens the muscles of the heart

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: The reality of failing to find a dream home in the countryside is setting in for Sue Radford so she hatches a dramatic plan by suggesting the family move to Florida. Noel and Sue agree to travel to the Sunshine State to look at some properties, but news of the impending trip sends the Ra rumour mill into overdrive, resulting in the biggest ever Radford family trip abroad

programme.title: Dying for Revenge
programme.desc: Factual crime documentary about revenge killings. When Clair Ablewhite, a popular member of the community, was murdered, her phone revealed a secret relationship - and a suspect

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: One of the department's new junior doctors treats a man with a suspected case of sepsis, that has been triggered by the tracheostomy tube he relies on to breathe. An 84-year-old woman is brought in by ambulance after falling down a flight of stairs and undergoes multiple x-rays to check for broken bones, while a 12-month-old baby needs treatment after having a fit

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out
programme.desc: Paramedic Jordan and special sergeant Hannah find a man unconscious and bleeding on a pavement. It turns out he's a known heroin-user with a history of breaking into cars, who appears to have been assaulted by the owner of a car he was attempting to rob

programme.title: Sleeping with My Murderer
programme.desc: When Suzanne Van Hagen was found dead by her daughter, the authorities believed it to be a sex game gone wrong. But it would take her family four years to prove otherwise

programme.title: 101 Near Misses

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and Ducky see an antique war stick on television that could be the missing murder weapon in a 16-year-old cold case. Drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service that investigates cases involving the US Navy and Marine Corps. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A woman withdraws her claims of domestic violence and Danny and Jackie's investigation into her motives reveals she is having an affair with a high-powered city councilman - who also happens to be a friend of Frank's. The case is complicated further when Angela shoots the politician in self-defence and a probe into his past indicates a history of abuse toward women. Danny faces upheaval at home when Linda makes plans to return to work at the hospital. Guest starring Richard Burgi (Desperate Housewives)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: FBI agent Dana Lewis suspects that a 25-year-old rape-murder case in New York is connected to several unsolved crimes across the country and joins the SVU to investigate. Lewis relentlessly pursues her prime suspect, but Benson and Amaro have their doubts about his guilt. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about?

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. Meanwhile, Tony and McGee try to find the perfect woman for Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The FBI alerts Frank to a potential bomb attack in Manhattan, and he puts the police on full alert in a bid to prevent disaster from striking the city. Drama, starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Three teenagers die and one falls seriously ill after taking drugs at a party, prompting Danny and Jackie to hunt for the supplier of the lethal narcotics. programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As the couple excitedly prepare for their wedding, Molly plans a special surprise by having Mary's estranged father attend the ceremony - but soon regrets her actions when the alcoholic sea-dog turns up in a drunken stupor. But that's just the first in a series of hiccups, as Reuben bursts into the church claiming Mary had already married him in Las Vegas. The blushing bride escapes from the ceremony, but William is hot on her heels - little suspecting the biggest shock is yet to come. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham

programme.title: Lioness: The Nicola Adams Story (2021)
programme.desc: Documentary following Nicola Adams, the double Olympic and WBO boxing champion, and the first woman to ever represent England in boxing

programme.title: Cracks (2009)
programme.desc: A nonconformist teacher at a girls' boarding school in 1930s Britain is an outsider among her colleagues but adored by her pupils. Drama, starring Eva Green and Juno Temple

programme.title: Radio On (1979)

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home.

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: A man commits suicide, but has no identification and can't be traced. To complicate matters, the coroner's report indicates he is 60 years old - even though he only looks 20. Before the team can investigate further, the corpse is stolen.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets out to visit some of the many islands that lay off the coastline. Heading to Foula and Fair Isle - the most remote island communities in Britain - he makes a nerve-racking visit to 'Da Snekk o' da Smallie' - a pothole in the cliffs of Foula that leads through to the Atlantic shore on the island, and learns about the beautiful knitting patterns that have made Fair Isle famous around the word

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton turns his attention to the country's landlocked islands. He travels to Loch Lomond to get a bird's-eye view of an iconic beauty spot, before gaining an insight into the lives of its residents

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The gang argue over who should rescue the kidnapped daughter of a village headman. Pigsy sneaks out behind the others' backs to look for her himself, but the remaining three friends soon follow his trail

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Dr Russell fights to save the life of a woman whose husband has been plagued by visions of the destruction of Moonbase Alpha. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Pamela Stephenson

programme.title: Dance With Me, Henry (1956)
programme.desc: The owners of a struggling amusement park get mixed up with the Mob as one struggles to pay his debts and the other faces losing his adopted kids. Comedy, with Abbott and Costello

programme.title: The Family Way (1966)
programme.desc: A Lancashire man's marriage is complicated by his impotence and the difficulties of living in the same house as his overbearing father. Comedy, starring John Mills and Hywel Bennett

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: In Britain today, 4.1 million children are growing up in poverty. Dispatches spent a year with three children and their families to show what life is really like if there's just not enough money for life's essentials of food, warmth and a place to call home

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: A Patch of Fog (2015)
programme.desc: A famous writer and academic living off the reputation of his single novel resorts to shoplifting to introduce some excitement to his stable life. He is caught in the act by a lonely, unbalanced security guard, who has an unusual price for his silence - he wants them to be friends, and goes to disturbing lengths to force himself into the author's life. Thriller, starring Stephen Graham, Conleth Hill and Lara Pulver

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: The detectives step in when an eminent economist is visited by the ghost of his wife

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert travels along the south coast of the Isle of Wight. He visits a shipwreck that has become a natural habitat for marine species such as the conger eel and spiny spider crab, and with the help of a local angler goes in search of smooth-hound sharks. Back on dry land, Ray finds out how the preserved footprints of an iguanodon reveal the way the dinosaur walked, observes a colony of ravens, and is introduced to the rare Glanville fritillary butterfly

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Isles of Scilly off the Cornish coast, where mild temperatures create an ideal habitat for species of wildlife normally associated with warmer climes. Exotic plants like the South African Hottentot fig thrive in the area, while an abundance of insects, including the rare red-barbed ant, means that migrant birds such as barn swallows use the islands as a source of sustenance

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As the couple excitedly prepare for their wedding, Molly plans a special surprise by having Mary's estranged father attend the ceremony - but soon regrets her actions when the alcoholic sea-dog turns up in a drunken stupor. But that's just the first in a series of hiccups, as Reuben bursts into the church claiming Mary had already married him in Las Vegas. The blushing bride escapes from the ceremony, but William is hot on her heels - little suspecting the biggest shock is yet to come. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham

programme.title: Seize the Day (1986)
programme.desc: An honest salesman fallen on hard times return to his New York roots and a reunion with his estranged father. Drama, starring Robin Williams and Glenne Headly

programme.title: Miss Annie Rooney (1942)
programme.desc: A poor family rally round to help their daughter get the perfect dress for her wealthy boyfriend's party. Comedy drama, starring Shirley Temple and William Gargan

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered
